analysis.Summary: Vue SFC that displays a black popup bar prompting an already registered user to sign in before checkout. It conditionally renders based on the `isOpen` reactive flag and shows a headline, explanatory text, and a "Sign In" button.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a UI section on the checkout or orders page that asks visiting users to log in for a faster checkout experience.

Components.name: AskToLogin
Components.responsibility: Encapsulates the login-prompt UI and open/close control via an internal `isOpen` state.

Components.name: …
Components.responsibility: Contains heading and descriptive text encouraging sign-in.

Components.name: <button>Sign In</button>
Components.responsibility: Triggers the action to open the sign-in popup via `toggleSignInPopup()`.

Functions.name: toggleSignInPopup
Functions.purpose: Should toggle or open the global/application-level sign-in popup.
Functions.notes: This function is invoked on button click but is not defined in this file—likely provided by parent via prop or global injection.

Dependencies.usage: Commented-out close icon for a possible future close button.

Dependencies.styles: global utility classes (bg-black, t-white, flex, etc.)
Dependencies.usage: Utility CSS classes from the project's SCSS framework.

analysis.Usage: Imported into parent order/checkout pages or layouts with `import AskToLogin from 'modules/orders/components/sections/AskToLogin.vue'` and then used as `<AskToLogin/>`. The parent is expected to provide or globally register the `toggleSignInPopup` handler.
Notes: The internal `isOpen` flag is initialized to true but there is no close handler defined—close icon section is commented out.
`toggleSignInPopup()` must be defined elsewhere (parent or a composable). Without it, clicking the button will throw an error.
Empty `<style lang="scss">` block suggests no component-scoped styles; all styling is via global utility classes.
